intro: Aglaia kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Kinabalu aglaia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are woody capsules that contain several seeds, and the plant is often found growing in shaded, humid environments. Aglaia kinabaluensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its mountainous habitat.
